item.title: Arbor Day 2026
item.description:
On the 20th of March we will celebrate Arbor Day!

Join us at the Ethnographic Museum of Canha at 16:00 and come and see what we have prepared for you.

We will inaugurate an exhibition in which you can participate:

We provide the base: a pallet (which can be purchased at the Canha Museum). The trees must be made in 3D, with a minimum height of 150 cm, with roots and recycled or natural materials, but they must be waterproof as the exhibition will be held outdoors. Entries must be submitted by March 16th at the Canha Museum.

In addition to the palette, we can provide some basic materials (such as glue, paint, etc.) upon request via private message.

This event will be supported by the Canha Parish Council.

Contacts for further information:

  • +351 962150073
  • +351 934441630

]

item.title: Canha Medieval Fair '26 at the BTL
item.description:
On February 28 at 19:30, the CIRCULODEMAJALIS association will present the Canha Medieval Fair ‘26 at Better Tourism - Lisbon Travel Market (BTL).

Where

At the Turismo de Lisboa stand, Pavilion 1, stand number 1C05a.

item.title: Canha Medieval Fair '26 will be present at BTL
item.description:
On the 28th of February at 19:30, the CIRCULODEMAJALIS group will be present at the Better Tourism - Lisbon Travel Market (BTL), where they will present the Canha Medieval Fair ‘26. Many surprises will be revealed.

We count with your presence! üëë

item.title: Register now for the "Oficinas de Dan√ßa" (dance workshop)
item.description:
Registration for the “Oficinas de Dan√ßa” dance workshop is now open!

In these dance workshops, you will have the opportunity to learn Medieval Dances from various origins (Italian, French, German) to participate in the Medieval Fair and other community events.

Two groups will be formed, one for adults and one for young people, with written authorization required from parents or guardians for those under 16 years of age.

How to Register

You can register by email: circulodemajalis@gmail.com, with the Registration Form filled.

You may ask for additional information by phone at +351 934441630 , or +351 962150073 .

Information

  • Start date: March 2026
  • Cost per person: Between ‚Ç¨10 and ‚Ç¨20 (the price depends on the number of registrations)
  • Location: Canha (Volunteer Fire Department)
  • Duration: 2 hours every 15 days

Classes will be taught by instructors Ana Costa and Beatriz Boleto.

To share on social media

We look forward to seeing you there!

item.title: Canha Medieval Fair 2026: Registration open for merchants
item.description:
Registration is now open for merchants, artisans, craftsmen, and traders for the 2nd Edition of the Canha Medieval Fair 2026.

Read the consultation and participation regulations.

item.title: Arbor Day 2026
item.description:
On the 20th of March we will celebrate Arbor Day!

Join us at the Ethnographic Museum of Canha at 16:00 and come and see what we have prepared for you.

We will inaugurate an exhibition in which you can participate:

We provide the base: a pallet (which can be purchased at the Canha Museum). The trees must be made in 3D, with a minimum height of 150 cm, with roots and recycled or natural materials, but they must be waterproof as the exhibition will be held outdoors. Entries must be submitted by March 16th at the Canha Museum.

In addition to the palette, we can provide some basic materials (such as glue, paint, etc.) upon request via private message.

This event will be supported by the Canha Parish Council.

  • +351 962150073
  • +351 934441630

item.title: Register now for the "Teatro Ra√≠z de Canha" group!
item.description:
Registration is now open for the ‚ÄúTeatro Ra√≠z de Canha‚Äù group.

If you like creating characters, improvising, and participating in small off-stage animations in the future, sign up! Two groups will be formed, one for adults and one for young people. Written authorization from parents or guardians is required for children aged 16 and under.

How to register

You can register by email: circulodemajalis@gmail.com, with the Registration Form filled.

You may ask for additional information by phone at: +351 934441630 , ou +351 962150073 .

Details

  • Start date: March 2026
  • Cost per person: Between ‚Ç¨10 and ‚Ç¨20 (the price depends on the number of registrations)
  • Location: Canha (Volunteer Fire Department)
  • Duration: 2 hours every 15 days

What to expect from the course

  • Theater training focused on improvisation techniques and interaction in an off-stage context.
  • Inclusion in the training of historical aspects relevant to the construction of characters and the interactions between characters and the historical environment.
  • Possibility of performing during the Canha Medieval Fair 2026 and/or in activities prior to the Fair.

Classes will be taught by accredited trainer Dinis Binnema (already known to everyone for his performances at the 2025 Canha Medieval Fair).

Share in Social Media

We look forward to seeing you there!

item.title: Christmas Market of Peg√µes
item.description:
We would like to thank Associa√ß√£o Arte com Vida for the opportunity to participate in the Peg√µes Christmas Market, which took place on December 12, 13, and 14, 2025, at the Cruzamento de Peg√µes church sports center, where we showcased some of the work created during 2025 by the participants of our association.

The party was very well organized and wonderful! Thank you.

item.title: Seminar "Migra√ß√µes, Observar, Conhecer e Pensar os Territ√≥rios"
item.description:
Our association was invited to participate and provide information.

On December 10, the seminar “Migrations, Observing, Understanding, and Thinking About Territories” will be held at the Sociedade Recreativa do Cruzamento de Peg√µes. The event will begin at 9:30 a.m.

This seminar is part of the project Rede Intercultural/PRR, OIL of Canha and Peg√µes.

Join us!

item.title: Lunch gathering at Moinho Novo 2025
item.description:
On November 30, we held our second MAJALIS lunch gathering at the beautiful Herdade do Moinho Novo, which our member Jos√© Carlos kindly made available free of charge.

It was the day after Creativity Day, so we visited the “Despertares” exhibition with members who were unable to attend the opening.

Three groups that helped us with the Medieval Fair were also invited to the lunch gathering, and we had another opportunity to thank them for their commitment and great help. We also distributed individual participation certificates and those from partner organizations.

Here are some photos of the event (Photos by Bernardo Patarra):

Delivery of the Certificates of Participations to individual and partner groups that helped during the 2025 Medieval Fair

Hightlights of the Lunch gathering

item.title: Creativity Day 2025: "Despertares"
item.description:
On November 17, another event organized by CIRCULODEMAJALIS was held at the Canha Ethnographic Museum, entitled ‚ÄúDespertares‚Äù (Awakening), celebrating creativity day

Community participation was once again exemplary, with a variety of projects and, as always, spectacular turnout!

After welcoming the children from the EB1/JI school in Canha, who participated for the first time this year with a beautiful piece of work, it was time for speeches from the official representatives. After the exhibition opened, the excitement and conviviality continued with a delicious snack and muscatel, offered by the Canha Parish Council, and some bread rolls kindly provided by Caf√© Central and Maria Ad√©lia Martins.

The event was also enlivened by actor Dinis Binnema, already known for his participation in our Medieval Fair in Canha.

We also had our new member of CIRCULODEMAJALIS, Bernardo Patarra, with his keen eye and talent for capturing with his camera what often escapes the naked eye. A big thank you also to everyone who, without participating directly with their work, helped make this Creativity Day possible, contributing to the growth of our cultural community and raising awareness of the world’s problems. And thank you to our president, Honorina Silvestre, who keeps the wheels turning!

The exhibition will be open during the Canha Museum’s opening hours until the end of December.

Works

  • “Acorda Oceano” by the Equipa de anima√ß√£o de Sta. Casa da Miseric√≥rdia de Canha
  • “Para a Paz” by the Casa do Povo de Canha, centro de dia e centro de atividades de tempos livres
  • “O Cibernauta” by Carolina Ver√≠ssimo, Cidaliza Fernandes, Ana Neves, Maria Jos√© Ferreira, Liberato Fernandes, Jo√£o Jacome and Honorina Silvestre
  • “Com amor” by Maria Fernanda Dias Comenda
  • “A arte de reviver” by Carolina Ver√≠ssimo
  • “M√£os que transformam” by the Academia S√©nior de Peg√µes e Canha
  • “Pres√©pio” and “Noivos” by Mariana Passos
  • “√â hora de agir” by Alzira Carrilho, Cristina Comenda, Natalina Patarra and Susana Pereira
  • “Pregos que cantam” by Maria Jos√© Ferreira and Cidaliza Fernandes
  • “Hoje n√£o…” by Sala de estudo da Sta. Casa da Miseric√≥rdia de Canha
  • “O Bairro” by Madalena Barreiros
  • “Bal√£o” by the EB1/JI school in Canha
  • “My Edge of Desire” by Vanda Pereira

Gallery

Entities from left to right:

  • Henrique Gomes (President of the Canha Parish Council)
  • Eng. Honorina Silvestre (President of CIRCULODEMAJALIS)
  • Gon√ßalo Nunes (from the fiscal council of CIRCULODEMAJALIS)
  • Armando Piteira (Former President of the Canha Parish Council)
  • Luis Miguel Afonso Dionisio (PS Deputy of the Parish Assembly)
  • Ricardo Bernardes (PS Councilor)
  • Dona Anabela Monteiro (President of the General Assembly of CIRCULODEMAJALIS)

Other highlights

item.title: Book launch "A voz dos montes e outros poemas" by Gabriel Mendes
item.description:
The launch of Gabriel Mendes’ book took place in the beautiful Chapel of St. Anthony (P√°tio D’√Ågua), which was very well organized by Mrs. Fernanda Pinho from the Montijo City Council.

With a full “house”, this event was highlighted by an excellent performance by Filipe Silva on guitar and vocals.

After our General Assembly President, Mrs. Anabela Monteiro, gave a brief introduction of who we are and what we do at our association CIRCULODEMAJALIS, it was the turn of Mrs. Esther from the MODOCROMIA publishing house to give a brief editorial explanation.

The writer and director Domingos Lobo presented the book, and was, as expected, eloquent and spectacular in his voice and literary analysis.

Cristina Comenda, Alzira Carrilho, and Ros√°rio Freitas treated us to a reading of three poems by the author, who also gave an emotional speech of thanks to those present.

We were also surprised by the poet and photographer Vitor Costeira (who had an exhibition on the same day), who also read one of the author’s poems.

The event ended with music and socializing over a glass of Muscatel in the chapel’s lobby. Also present at this event were the head of the cultural department, Dr. Manuela Marcelino, and the head of communications for the Montijo City Council (CMM), Mr. Eduardo Martins, who has given so much support to this association. Our thanks to all our MAJALIS friends for their presence and support, and of course also to the CMM team who made this event possible.

With this “One Year, One Book” project, we affirm our willingness to also support the members of our Association! In addition, the donation for each book goes towards anthropological studies in Canha!

Support this cause! The book can be purchased at the following locations:

  • WOOK - Gabriel Mendes
  • Almedina - A Voz dos Montes e Outros Poemas
  • Bertrand Livreiros - Gabriel Mendes
  • fnac - A Voz dos Montes e Outros Poemas

… and, of course, through our Association by email circulodemajalis@gmail.com.

With the support of Montijo Municipal Council.

item.title: Looking for artists for Creativity Day 2025
item.description:
With the theme “Despertares” (Awakenings), MAJALIS invites everyone (friends, associations, individuals) to participate with a creative work using mostly recycled materials (paper, newspaper, fabrics, lace, plastics, wood, cork, etc.) using any techniques you wish (collages, modeling, painting, etc.).

Please inform the Association of the basis on which you will be creating your work and whether you need support. We need to know who is participating by November 2.

The deadline for submission is November 12, 2025!

Contacts:

  • Email: circulodemajalis@gmail.com
  • Mobile: 934 441 630 / 962 150 073

To share on social media:

item.title: "Feira Medieval" submitted to "Turismo de Portugal"
item.description: We would like to thank Dr. Carla Salsinha, president of the regional tourism board of Lisbon, for her sensitivity in understanding our project, the first edition of the Feira Medieval de Canha (Canha Medieval Fair), and for agreeing to submit it to Turismo de Portugal.

item.title: Canha Medieval Fair 2025
item.description:
For three days, Canha, known for its tranquility and natural beauty, was transformed into a true medieval setting.

Useful Links

  • Program
  • Gallery
  • Map

The oldest town in the municipality of Montijo held a historical reenactment transporting visitors back to 1235, the year in which Vila Nova de Canha received its charter from the Order of Santiago during the reign of King Sancho II.

"Fair Opening"
Click to open on YouTube

The first edition of the Canha Medieval Fair featured a diverse and exciting program. See the full program here.

"Fire Shows"
Click to open on YouTube

Fire shows lit up the nights, while medieval music concerts transported visitors to another era. There were also three major concerts outside the Burgo with Galandum Galundaina, Sebasti√£o Antunes e Quadrilha, and Barro Negro.

"Galandum Galundaina"
Click to open on YouTube

"Sebasti√£o Antunes e Quadrilha"
Click to open on YouTube

Moonlight Suppers

With music, historical reenactments, and plenty of entertainment between courses, “From the Lands of Canha to the Table”, medieval dinners from the time of King Sancho II attracted large crowds.

Tournaments

Weapons and horseback tournaments and parades alluding to the era completed the immersion in the Middle Ages.

"Horse Riding Tournament"
Click to open on YouTube

Dances

There were games for children and adults, traditional and Arabic dances, horsemen, theater, an exhibition of the royal chambers, and a colloquium on Canha in the Middle Ages, facade contests, immersive games, and a whole magical atmosphere of the time with its craftsmen and merchants.

With free admission, this Fair was mainly held within the gates of the village of Canha, in the square and in the Canha Ethnographic Museum, and counted on the indispensable participation of all the groups and associations of Canha: Sta. Casa da Miseric√≥rdia, Associa√ß√£o dos Bombeiros Volunt√°rios de Canha, Casa do Povo de Canha, Comiss√£o de Festas, as well as many other groups organized with the people of Canha specifically for this event.

What set the Medieval Fair apart was the quality of the participating groups and the interaction with the local people, who also took part in small theatrical performances and traditional dances, which, thanks to CIRCULODEMAJALIS, made the whole festival the success that it was.

This event was promoted by the Montijo City Council and organized by our association CIRCULODEMAJALIS with the support of the Canha Parish Council and Turismo de Portugal through Dr. Carla Salsinha, president of the Lisbon Region Regional Tourism Authority.

Interview with Honorina Silvestre

President of the CIRCULODEMAJALIS association

Click to open on YouTube

Support and Acknowledgements

Our thanks to Dr. Carla Salsinha, President of the regional tourism authority for the Lisbon region, for her sensitivity in understanding our project for the Canha Medieval Fair, and for her willingness to accept to submit it to Portugal Events*.

Application to Portugal Events

External Links

Some external articles on this year’s edition of the Canha Medieval Fair:

  • Montijo On City »> Canha Viaja no Tempo: Feira Medieval in√©dita promete agitar a regi√£o em julho
  • Di√°rio do Distrito »> Canha transforma-se numa aut√™ntica vila medieval com feira hist√≥rica imperd√≠vel!
  • O Cidad√£o: Canha revive o ano de 1235 com a sua primeira Feira Medieval
  • O Setubalense: Feira Medieval de Canha arranca esta tarde com um modelo diferenciado
  • Gazeta Rural: 1.¬™ Feira Medieval de Canha de 11 a 13 de julho

item.title: Exposi√ß√£o "Aves em Canha" no Montijo
item.description:
From June 26 to July 2, 2025, during the St. Peter festivities in Montijo, CIRCULODEMAJALIS was present with the traveling exhibition “Aves em Canha” by Cristina Archer.

Some pictures of the event:

Click to open on YouTube

item.title: II‚Åø·µà Majalis Anniversary
item.description:
On May 17th, we celebrated our Majalis Anniversary.

Watch the video of the event here:

Click to open on YouTube

The gathering took place at the Canha Volunteer Fire Department with the show “A Lily in the Heart”. The room was too small for so many people, which made us very happy and grateful. We started with the Cavaquinhos Sinfonias Group and the Serenatas e Sinfonias ao Luar Group, followed by a performance by the Peg√µes and Canha Senior Academy. The children of the Banda da Casa do Povo de Canha showed off their musical skills, and Cl√°udia and Manuel Ver√≠ssimo treated us, as usual, to their beautiful voices.

There was a poem recited by Maria do Ros√°rio, and Joana Maia’s Hip Hop dance group left everyone speechless, young and old alike, with their rhythm and excellent choreography. The Sevillanas La Ca√±a and the Folkloric and Ethnographic Ranch of Santa Casa da Miseric√≥rdia, who have already accustomed us to their quality, were also there and were greatly applauded!

Finally, our cake, for which some members of CIRCULODEMAJALIS rushed to provide the ingredients, was deliciously prepared under the guidance of Rosa Oliveira and baked at Santa Casa.

A special thanks to all the participants and helpers who made this wonderful day possible!

Acknowledgments

item.title: World Tree Day 2025
item.description:
On March 21st, at the invitation of the CIRCULODEMAJALIS Association and jointly organized with the Canha Ethnographic Museum, magic happened!

With the participation of associations, groups, families, communities, residents of Canha, and others, the collective exhibition of the Enchanted Forest (Floresta Encantada) delighted young and old alike, drawing attention to the importance of forest preservation. We all have art within us, let’s use it to change the world!

Well done!

Here is a video illustrating the event:

Click to open on YouTube

Schedule

4:00 p.m. - Planting of plant species in the vertical garden with the help of Catl. and seniors from Casa do Povo, Canha Preschool, and Catl. and seniors from Sta. Casa da Miseric√≥rdia. Location: Rua do Lagar in Canha.

Around 4:30 p.m. - Opening of the exhibition “The Enchanted Forest” with poetry recitation followed by a social gathering. Location: Ethnographic Museum of Canha

Panels

Curation by Mafalda Salt√£o and Honorina Silvestre

  1. “√Årvore Colorida” by Sala de estudo da Sta. Casa da Miseric√≥rdia de Canha
  2. “Ra√≠zes em Movimento” by Academia S√©nior de Peg√µes e Canha
  3. “O Enraizar da Vida” by the Pereira Family
  4. “Arvore de Esperan√ßa” by the Ver√≠ssimo and Carvalheira Family
  5. “Como Galhos de uma √Årvore todos crescemos em dire√ß√µes diferentes, mas a raiz √© a mesma” by the animation team of the Sta. Casa da Miseric√≥rdia de Canha
  6. “Florescer” by Anabela Novais Castro
  7. “De uma √Årvore nascem v√°rias” by children from the CATL Casa do Povo de Canha
  8. “Passado, presente e futuro” by the voluntary firefighters of Canha
  9. “√Årvore Encantada” by Ana Comenda and Lurdes Correia
  10. “Somos uma Fam√≠lia” by the Canha school
  11. “Arbor dos Passarinhos” by Fernanda and Natalina Patarra
  12. “√Årvore Primavera” by Silvia Rodrigues and Anabela Monteiro
  13. “A Primavera” by Mariana Marques, Carolina Ver√≠ssimo, Maria Aurora Ver√≠ssimo, Agripina David, Cidalina, In√™s Mestre, and Liberato Fernandes
  14. “Florir a vida” by Centro de Dia da Casa do Povo de Canha
  15. “Hamadraia e o Pequeno Sol” by Rosa Oliveira
  16. “√Årvore da Paz” by Catequese de par√≥quia de N. Sra. da Oliveira
  17. “Brilho da Poesia” by Alzira Carrilho and Cristina Comenda
  18. “Plantar uma √Årvore e Cuidar do Amanh√£” by the Comiss√£o de Festas de Canha
  19. “Consciencializar” by H√©lder Piteira
  20. “Bot√£o de Esperan√ßa” by Honorina Silvestre

Acknowledgments

item.title: Canha Medieval Fair '25 at BTL
item.description:
At 18:30 on Saturday, March 15, 2025, we were at the BTL, at FIL in Lisbon, which is the country’s largest tourism fair, promoting the Canha Medieval Fair, together with the Montijo City Council. There was live music, tastings and lots of entertainment. Our thanks to the Montijo City Council and especially to everyone who came to visit us!

Below are some impressions of the event:

[(./001-full.jpg) [(./002-full.jpg) [(./003-full.jpg)

Click to open on YouTube

item.title: Lunch at the Herdade do Moinho Novo
item.description: On November 24th, following the event “Rendilhadas”, we had our get-together at Herdade do Moinho Novo, whose space was generously made available to the Association by the owner. As we were already in the Advent, it was also our Christmas meeting.

item.title: Rendilhadas / Creativity Day 2024
item.description:
MAJALIS celebrates Creativity Day annually, recognizing that each person’s creativity is the surest tool for adapting to social changes and facing the challenges of new times, ensuring a life of quality.

This principle is one of the pillars of our work, which we wish to continue to develop.

The Challenge to the Community

This year, we launched a challenge to the community: to reuse unused lace and, with it, build a tribute to women. Women, whom we recognize as the main workers in this type of work, were the central focus of this initiative.

The project involved the collaboration of senior and junior users of Santa Casa da Miseric√≥rdia and Casa do Povo de Canha. It was a joint effort, carried out with commitment and sharing.

Opening of the Exhibition

We inaugurated the exhibition with the participation of those who contributed to the project and with the presence of the community who were able and willing to collaborate.

The moment was celebrated with a gathering around roasted chestnuts and √°gua-p√©, kindly provided by the Canha Parish Council.

Here is the link to the film of the event:

Click to open on YouTube

Acknowledgments

item.title: Exposition / Book Launch "Mem√≥rias com Asas"
item.description:
In September 2024, we held the presentation of the book “Mem√≥rias com Asas” (Memories with Wings) and the exhibition “Aves em Canha” (Birds in Canha) at our headquarters, which was still undergoing the necessary renovations.

This book proposes a rural and an urban walking trail, through which people can discover the birds of the region.

Studies, interviews, illustrations, photographs, observation trails, and the graphic presentation of the book were all prepared by some of our members.

The illustrations in the book were done by Cristina Archer and the originals were used to create the exhibition.

Two wine tastings took place in parallel:

  • one by the Stanley Ho Foundation, with wines produced in the Canha floodplains
  • another of organic wines from Herdade do Alto do Pina, in the parish of Poceir√£o.

This was followed by a moment of conviviality between the Associates and the Community:

Click to open on YouTube

Acknowledgements

item.title: World Tree Day 2024
item.description:
To celebrate this day, we created a special bonsai tree with the help of the community. This collective work was made from recycled materials from other construction projects (pipes, coatings, wood, nets, etc.), as well as leftover wool and wool purchased by all the participants.

A total of 1390 pom-poms were made, which were carefully crafted over the course of several weeks.

On March 21st, with the collaboration of children and young people from the parish, a magnolia tree was planted in the front garden of the Canha Ethnographic Museum, symbolizing our commitment to nature.

The planting was accompanied by some senior residents of Santa Casa da Miseric√≥rdia, who also participated in this meaningful action. After the task, we had the privilege of welcoming the community involved in the project, as well as those who were able to attend.

Everyone found the bonsai an interesting piece of work, and many took the opportunity to take pictures next to it, celebrating the art and the environment.

Next, we held a community snack, the main objective of which was to share and promote healthy foods, strengthening the spirit of unity and care for our health and the planet.

The children took home a pom-pom, along with a small brochure that explained the importance of trees in the environment and in the lives of all beings that inhabit our planet.

Acknowledgments

item.title: Canha Festivities / "Momento" Gallery
item.description:
So we began with the first MAJALIS Exhibition in 2023… Organized by Ricardo Cruzes and curated by architect Carlos Ribeiro at the Ethnographic Museum of Canha.

Ricardo Cruzes was born in France. He graduated in “Painting and Communication Design” from ARCA-EUAC, where he had the opportunity to study with great names such as Armando Azevedo, Jo√£o Dixo, and Ant√≥nio Modesto.

After gaining experience in the business world as a manager and producer of creative projects in various design disciplines, in 2008 he decided to intensify his artistic activity, holding his first public demonstrations in 2009.

Ricardo Cruzes is currently Artist in Residence at LAC - Laborat√≥rio de Atividades Criativas (Creative Activities Laboratory) in Lagos, Portugal, where he has been practicing art full-time since April 2021.

At the invitation of MAJALIS, he exhibited some of his works during the Festas de Nossa Sra. da Oliveira in 2023.

Acknowledgments

item.title: IÀ¢·µó Majalis Anniversary
item.description:
Our anniversary is celebrated in May, on a date to be determined.

And it is in May because the lily of the valley (our Majalis) is the flower of May. However, this first anniversary was celebrated on June 1.

We brought our members together with the community who were able and willing to attend. At the Canha Fire Station, there were:

  • The Sevillanas of Canha: La Canha
  • The Ethnographic Ranch of Canha
  • The children of the SCM of Canha’s CATL
  • The Academy of Seniors of Canha and Peg√µes

These entities performed after the dramatization of the legend of the nightingale and the lily of the valley. The presentation featured performances by Cl√°udia Carvalheira (who also sang), Tiago Almeida, Diana Almeida, as well as the younger children from catechism class.

Then we sang Happy Birthday!

item.title: About us
item.description:
About CIRCULODEMAJALIS

Founded January 13th 2023, the non-profit association CIRCULODEMAJALIS aims to:

  • develop solidarity and social responsibility among citizens,
  • value creativity and culture as pillars of freedom and drivers of change, and
  • build bridges between communities and other associations.

Among other activities, these are part of our action plan:

  • Workshops
  • Reuse of materials (World Tree Day, Rendilhadas)
  • Art galleries (Aves em Canha, Rendilhadas)
  • Recreation of historic events (2025 Medieval Fair)
  • Create conditions for community participation by all residents
  • Create activities that recreate traditional events: bread making, lace and embroidery, gardening, traditional crafts, pottery, etc. (Rendilhadas)
  • Collaboration in decorating the streets for the Canha Festivities
  • Book publications (Mem√≥rias com Asas)
  • Creation of an annual event focusing on music and art in May
  • Study of streets
  • Create a public meeting place where art is present
  • Complete the construction work at headquarters

Social Bodies

General Assembly

  • President: Anabela dos Santos Monteiro Domingues
  • Vice President: Cl√°udia Isabel Ver√≠ssimo Carvalheira
  • Secretary: Sara Raquel Martinho Salgueiro Maia

Administration

  • President: Honorina Maria Pereira Silvestre
  • Vice President: Ana Patr√≠cia Neves Santos
  • Secretary: Ana Rita Godinho Galego
  • Treasurer: Maria do Ros√°rio Ferreira Dias
  • Voting Member: Pedro David Sousa Neves
  • Reserve Member: Maria Lisete Gomes Perrin de Almeida
  • Reserve Member: Bruna Scherdien dos Santos
  • Reserve Member: Sandra Ferr√£o Coelho

  • Reserve Member: Ruben Neves

Contact

item.title: Join us!
item.description:
